Legal_Issue: Whether refusal to perform military service due to personal convictions constitutes grounds for refugee status under IRPA
Evidence_Type: Evidence that Turkey's military activities had ceased, conscripts not deployed in conflict zones
Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on refugee status and persecution on Convention grounds
Basis_of_Claim: Personal aversion to combat and potential involvement in atrocities
Evaluation_Standard: Persecution on Convention grounds required for refugee status
Key_Factor_in_Determination: No deployment of conscripts in conflict zones; no link to internationally condemned conduct
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection claim followed by judicial review
Assessment_Standard: Objective risk of persecution on Convention grounds
Legal_Standard: Persecution must be on grounds recognized by the Refugee Convention
Application_Factor: Conscientious objection not established due to lack of evidence of persecution
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the Boardâ€™s decision reasonable in law and fact?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA section on refugee protection and Convention grounds
Cause_of_Refusal: Refusal based on personal convictions without nexus to persecution or Convention grounds
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence linking refusal to serve with persecution or war crimes
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of conscientious objection based on moral opposition to military service
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Refugee Convention
